sentence.Network_en: Don't say that, even in jest.
sentence.Network_cn: 别那么说，即便是开玩笑也不行。

sentence.Network_en: It was a jest rather than a reproach.
sentence.Network_cn: 这与其说是责备，还不如说是句玩笑呢。

人教版六年级英语基础知识复习资料_百度知道 ... in， 如： in jest 诙谐地， in joke 开玩笑地，.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from earlier gest, from Old French geste, from Latin gesta 'actions, exploits', from gerere 'do'. The original sense was 'exploit, heroic deed', hence a narrative of such deeds (originally in verse); later the term denoted an idle tale, hence a joke (mid 16th cent.)

entry.def: A jest is something that you say that is intended to be amusing.

example.ex: It was a jest rather than a reproach...
example.tran: 这与其说是责备，还不如说是句玩笑呢。

example.ex: The men talk as cheerfully as ever; jests are bandied about freely.
example.tran: 男人们像往常一样高兴地聊着，彼此间随意开着玩笑。

entry.def: If you jest, you tell jokes or say amusing things.

example.ex: He enjoyed drinking and jesting with his cronies...
example.tran: 他喜欢和老朋友喝喝酒、开开玩笑。

example.ex: A newspaper half jested: Had alcohol not already killed him, this would surely drive him to drink.
example.tran: 一份报纸半开玩笑地写道：要不是喝酒已经要了他的命，这肯定会让他想要喝上一杯。

means.word_mean: 1. a humorous anecdote or remark intended to provoke laughter;

sentences.sentence: "even a schoolboy's jape is supposed to have some ascertainable point"
"He often jokes even when he appears serious"

means.word_mean: 2. act in a funny or teasing way

auth_sentence.content: This had worked for him before, in Infinite Jest.
auth_sentence.res_content: This had worked for him before, in Infinite Jest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This had worked for him before, in Infinite Jest.

auth_sentence.content: He...made an oath he would never jest at spirits again.
auth_sentence.res_content: He...made an oath he would never jest at spirits again.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He...made an oath he would never jest at spirits again.

auth_sentence.content: Then no one would question his worth, even in jest.
auth_sentence.res_content: Then no one would question his worth, even in jest.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Then no one would question his worth, even in jest.

sentences.en: Don’t jest with me, young man.
sentences.cn: 年轻人, 别跟我开玩笑。

sentences.en: The remark was made half in jest.
‘Many a true word is spoken in jest,’ thought Rosie (= people often say things as a joke that are actually true).
sentences.cn: 罗丝想：“许多真话都是在玩笑间不经意说出来的。”

sentences.en: I said you look terrible in jest, actually, you look very pretty.
sentences.cn: 我说你看上去很糟糕是开玩笑, 其实你看上去很漂亮。
